title: Problems moving from POP3 to IMAP
content: I use Windows 11, Thunderbird both current versions. I recently had a problem with my server at Spectrum in that I could not receive emails as a POP3 account. I backed up my profile and contacted Spectrim, knowing I would have to do some tweaking on the configuration because that‚Äôs what they ask you to do. After many calls and nearly 3 weeks, they decided that if I wanted email, I would have to switch to IMAP protocol even though I have used Thunderbird as a POP3 client for more than 5 years. After more requested configuration tweaks, I decided to uninstall the mangled version of Thunderbird, download the latest version, install it as an IMAP protocol client. It is now working as IMAP, but now I need to bring over my address book and messages from the POP profile, which I am now finding a bit awkward. I don‚Äôt want to do an import from the saved profile, as there are differences in configuration and I don‚Äôt want to just bring over everything, but really all I want is the address book and my messages. I have figured out the address book and done that, but I‚Äôm concerned about the messages. If I import from the saved (POP) profile, can I just import the appropriate folders from the MAIL file only ?

title: Thunderbird blocks / long delay when displaying end-to-end encrypted email
content:
In both my Inbox and my saved email folders, when I click on an end-to-end encrypted email, Thunderbird (v145) displays "Loading Message..." and then blocks with a spinning blue "working" cursor for on the order of 30-60 seconds. The Thunderbird dialog then appears to make some progress, as the windows seems to "flash" as if it's being cleared, but the email content doesn't appear. After about another 20-30 seconds, the encrypted email contents appear, correctly decrypted.

This long delay only occurs when I click on encrypted email messages, and it happens every time I click on an encrypted email message, and this behavior only started occurring in the past couple of days (correlated, I believe with Thunderbird updating to v145) so I think it's safe to assume the issue is with end-to-end encryption/decryption in Thunderbird v145.

title: Thunderbird stops downloading from Pop3 account in the middle of the process, and doesn't delete messages from the server.
content:
Hi,

Thunderbird 140.5.0esr started acting weird with my Pop3 account. Normally it downloads all the messages (300-500 daily) and then deletes them from the server, as expected. However, during the last few months I have experienced 3 issues. In all, TB starts the downloading, than pauses at some point (like "Downloading 189 of 291") then ends the downloading process. At that point I have some of the downloaded messages in my Inbox, and ALL of the messages are at the server too. If I restart the downloading again, I end up with duplicate messages in my Inbox, and all the messages still at the server.

I, than, have to identify which messages have been downloaded, delete them from the server manually (with IMAP client) and start the downloading process on TB again, and this goes on until all messages are downloaded.

Any suggestions ? How can I troubleshoot this issue ?

Regards.
creator: mscag

title: Thunderbird no longer able to display S/MIME encrypted messages sent from Outlook App (Android and iOS)
content:
From Microsoft: "Recent Outlook Mobile updates introduced a stricter and more standards-aligned S/MIME message structure. The messages themselves are valid, but some third‚Äëparty mail clients such as Thunderbird do not fully support the way Outlook mobile structures the encryption. As a result, these clients may display a blank message body even though the encrypted content is present.

As a workaround, if you need to send encrypted mail to recipients who use third‚Äëparty clients, use Outlook desktop or Outlook on the web instead of Outlook mobile. These versions generate encrypted messages in a format that is more widely supported. "

I couldn't find this reported anywhere in these forums. Is there a solution being worked on to address this issue? Or has anyone found a workaround? We are stuck with using the Outlook app until the Thunderbird app supports S/MIME.
creator: traderboy

title: Thunderbird beantwoording mail
content:
Goedemiddag,

Op mijn iets oudere Acer Aspire 3 laptop (Intel i5, 10e generatie) heb ik Windows 11 ge√Ønstalleerd (schone installatie), ipv voorheen Windows 10. Alle andere progs en data waren dus van de laptop verwijderd. W11 functioneert nu goed, daarbij geen hardware problemen. Al meerdere programma's opnieuw geinstalleerd en werkend. Ook een actuele Thunderbird Setup 145.0 gedownload en ge√Ønstalleerd. Daarin twee (al lang bestaande) email accounts aangemaakt. Aanmelding van beide mailaccounts bij de server van (dezelfde) mailprovider is geslaagd. Ik gebruik (voorlopig) nog geen VPN, doe ik later.

Vraag A. Wanneer ik een testmail stuurt van mailaccount 1 (Van) naar mailaccount 2 (Aan) komt die in mailaccount 2 goed binnen. Wanneer ik in mailaccount 2 in het binnengekomen bericht op beantwoorden klik, opent een nieuw Re-schermpje, met daarin (foutief) in vak "Van" het mailadres van account 1, en in vak "Aan" het mailadres van account 2 (dat hoort bij beantwoorden andersom te zijn). Als ik vervolgens op verzenden druk wordt inderdaad foutief van account 1 naar 2 verstuurt in plaats van andersom. Ik heb bij de Thunderbird accountinstellingen gezocht naar de opties voor het instellen van "beantwoorden", maar die kan ik nergens vinden. Naar ik meen waren die opties er vroeger wel. Thunderbird vervolgens geheel verwijderd, opnieuw gedownload en geinstalleerd. Vervolgens nieuwe testmailtjes. Helaas geen verbetering van dit euvel. Hoe los ik dit op?

Vraag B: Voorheen maakte ik gebruik van de optie "tekst voor ondertekening". Bij bovengenoemde nieuwe installatie heb ik opnieuw NAW-ondertekeningstekst ingevoerd (HTML aan), op meerdere tekstregels (dus met omhaaltjes). Wanneer ik echter een nieuw bericht aanmaak zet Thunderbird alle tekst achter elkaar, dus zonder omhaaltjes. Hoe kan ik dit verbeteren?
creator: andre.droege1

title: FAILED TO CHECK FOR UPDATES
content: Yesterday I opened Thunderbird to find that it was trying to download 8205 emails. 15 emails actually downloaded, there were no messages in SPAM folder. The notification at the lower right showed 300 more had 'downloaded' before I shut off the internet, went into Safe Mode, ran a virus check to find no threats found. No SPAM was recorded in Thunderbird when I went back online. There were, however, several files with large attachments so I don't know if this is a glitch regarding data vs. actual number emails because when I checked for updates (see attachment) I discovered that since Version 115.4.2 I HAVE NEVER BEEN NOTIFIED OF UPDATES OR *FAILURE* TO UPDATE. AUTOMATIC UPDATES have been turned off and will remain turned off due to nearly dialup speed lack of bandwidth. I will abandon Thunderbird for having a fatal programming defect before turning on automatic updates. My actual email provider did not show 8205 additional emails so I am concerned about a possible malware backdoor. Today 15 emails downloaded while the little notice at lower right said it was trying to download 113 ghost emails. I shut off Thunderbird and came here to post the problem. I will update Thunderbird, but need to know if there is a temporary file cache or some other hideyhole that the ghosts (or some attacker) might be storing godnosewhat so that I can either quarantine or delete them?
creator: artrules

title: Transferring Thunderbird to a new PC
content: Hi, I'm trying to help a friend to transfer Thunderbird to a new PC. The old PC is running Windows 10 and I have updated the Thunderbird version prior to attempted transfer. The new PC is running Windows 11. I have followed all the online instructions regarding moving profiles from one PC to another. He has two email addresses in Thunderbird, one being gmail. He has also created a number of folders into which he has neatly saved incoming emails. Each time I copy the existing profile (over 10gb) and transfer this to the new PC as per instructions, there are missing folders which don't appear to have been transferred successfully. All his emails appear to be there as well as his address book but there are several missing folders containing important emails. His created folders are in alphabetical order but the only ones transferred successfully are the ones beginning A to C. All the rest of his folders D onwards have not appeared. I'm finding this very frustrating and would appreciate any help and support. I'm not too tech savvy but can usually overcome issues like this. Should I try the export/import route to transfer all his emails and folders to the new PC or is there something else "profile related" that I could try. Thankyou very much.
creator: johnnief
